results.title: In the beginning
results.brief_description: A colourful clay animation film which satirizes society and its impulse to invent nuclear weapons which cause self-destruction. Looks at the invention of destructive weapons from raspberries to rockets! Narration: Brian Woods. Animation: Mark D’Arcy-Irvine, Masfufah Sani. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Soft soap
results.brief_description: Antics of Peter and Harry, two dedicated but “out of tune” artists who devote their time obsessively to recreating the characters of Harlequin and Pierrot. Designed to draw attention to the insidious ways in which advertising techniques manipulate the consumer in the market place. Shot in Melbourne. Stars Max Gillies and Joe Bolza.

results.title: Eclipse
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A time lapse study of the 1976 eclipse, as seen from the Shrine of Remembrance in Melbourne. Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Place Across the River
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description: Explore the rich history of Melbourne through the National Gallery of Victoria site in St Kilda Road, Melbourne, via its various uses, as a circus site in 1887 to the landmark cultural centre it became. Mixes found footage, stills and contemporary footage.

results.title: The Seven bridges of Koenigsberg
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cornwell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: An animated film concerned with solving the problem of crossing the seven bridges of Koenigsberg, Germany, in a single continuous walk. Early attempts to solve it by trial and error are shown, including Leonard Euler’s analysis of the problem. This is a clearly explained and attractive film which would complement a study on topology or network theory. No other credits available. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Circus nomads
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, David Hughes, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This film aims to portray the circus as a nomadic way of life, to give viewers a deeper insight into aspects of circus life, and to show the circus as a form of theatre where the clown is king.

results.title: The Dam builders
results.creator_credit: Cine Service and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the Melbourne water supply system and the efforts of the MMBW to create enjoyable environments such as landscaping and recreation facilities in several catchment areas. Highlights the construction of the Cardinia Reservoir, near Emerald, now the largest storage area for Melbourne.

results.title: Applause please
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Experimental Film & Television Fund
results.brief_description: This film makes a personal statement on TV and commercial advertising and their insidious effect on the susceptibility of people. The message is given using an avant-garde style, told in mime and dramatics. Cast includes Max Gillies, Joe Bolza and Bob Thorneycroft and original music performed by Frank Zappa.

results.title: Round and around
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Produced for use in primary schools to stimulate interest in Melbourne’s annual Royal Agricultural Show. Shows without commentary all the hectic activity of displays, sideshows and the excitement of the Grand Parade.
